bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 60 (Thursday, April 6, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. Mr. POSEY:H.R. 2512.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:Governrnent Operations & Politics[Page H1711]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

summary.text:
Congressional Foreign Entanglement Disclosure and Reduction Act

This bill expands financial disclosure reporting provisions to require each Member of Congress to report any business ties that the Member, or the Member's immediate family, has with a foreign entity.

bill.title: Congressional Foreign Entanglement Disclosure and Reduction Act

item.title: Congressional Foreign Entanglement Disclosure and Reduction Act
Congressional Foreign Entanglement Disclosure and Reduction Act
To amend title 5, United States Code, to require Members of Congress to disclose business ties with foreign entities, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
